message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.DB, cs.LG, cs.CC 

This paper discusses the concept of differential privacy, which is commonly studied in the field of computer security and privacy (cs.CR). It also uses information theory to model the query system (cs.IT) and compares differential privacy with min-entropy leakage, which is related to Bayesian inference (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the utility of the randomization mechanism, which is a common concern in database research (cs.DB). Finally, the paper proposes a method for building an optimal randomization mechanism, which involves computational complexity (cs.CC).
